overview: "I wish my desires were more vegetal, fungal," says Adham Faramaway in "Skin Flick": a film, a membrane, a skin to inhabit, to shed, to entangle, to share across interspecies kingdoms. "Skin Flick" invites us to a slippery world where desire, identity and bodies ground themselves in the slime they so often produce. Prepare to mix toxins, ointments, creams, bodily fluids, Pepsi, soil and contaminants, to test the boundaries of our porous bodies and sense of self.
title: Skin Flick
